publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1881# George Lyon: Job Losses in Campbeltown—That the Parliament deeply regrets the closure of the Jaeger Factory in Campbeltown; notes that the loss of 200 jobs is a devastating blow to the Kintyre economy, and believes that the Scottish Executive should provide backing and support to allow local agencies to develop a rescue package for the area which recognises that the loss of the town’s largest employer is a further, serious blow to a town already affected by the downturn in traditional rural industries.
S1M-1881# Job Losses in Campbeltown (lodged on 27 April 2001) Brian Adam*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-1881# Job Losses in Campbeltown (lodged on 27 April 2001) Mr John Farquhar Munro*, Tavish Scott*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*

S1M-1881# George Lyon: Job Losses in Campbeltown—That the Parliament deeply regrets the closure of the Jaeger Factory in Campbeltown; notes that the loss of 200 jobs is a devastating blow to the Kintyre economy, and believes that the Scottish Executive should provide backing and support to allow local agencies to develop a rescue package for the area which recognises that the loss of the town’s largest employer is a further, serious blow to a town already affected by the downturn in traditional rural industries. Supported by: Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr John Farquhar Munro, Tavish Scott, Mr Duncan Hamilton
S1M-1881# Job Losses in Campbeltown (lodged on 27 April 2001) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1881# George Lyon: Job Losses in Campbeltown—That the Parliament deeply regrets the closure of the Jaeger Factory in Campbeltown; notes that the loss of 200 jobs is a devastating blow to the Kintyre economy, and believes that the Scottish Executive should provide backing and support to allow local agencies to develop a rescue package for the area which recognises that the loss of the town’s largest employer is a further, serious blow to a town already affected by the downturn in traditional rural industries. Supported by: Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr John Farquhar Munro, Tavish Scott, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Nora Radcliffe
S1M-1881# Job Losses in Campbeltown (lodged on 27 April 2001) Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-1881# George Lyon: Job Losses in Campbeltown—That the Parliament deeply regrets the closure of the Jaeger Factory in Campbeltown; notes that the loss of 200 jobs is a devastating blow to the Kintyre economy, and believes that the Scottish Executive should provide backing and support to allow local agencies to develop a rescue package for the area which recognises that the loss of the town’s largest employer is a further, serious blow to a town already affected by the downturn in traditional rural industries. Supported by: Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr John Farquhar Munro, Tavish Scott, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie McGrigor

S1M-1881# George Lyon: Job Losses in Campbeltown—That the Parliament deeply regrets the closure of the Jaeger Factory in Campbeltown; notes that the loss of 200 jobs is a devastating blow to the Kintyre economy, and believes that the Scottish Executive should provide backing and support to allow local agencies to develop a rescue package for the area which recognises that the loss of the town’s largest employer is a further, serious blow to a town already affected by the downturn in traditional rural industries. Supported by: Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr John Farquhar Munro, Tavish Scott, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie McGrigor
